Package it.polimi.ingsw.controller

Class Controller

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.observer.Observable<java.lang.Object>
it.polimi.ingsw.controller.Controller
All Implemented Interfaces:
VCEventListener, java.lang.Runnable
public class Controller
extends Observable<java.lang.Object>
implements VCEventListener, java.lang.Runnable
Game Controller. This class is the core of the software system. It communicates with the Model and the View(s) to let the game evolve properly. Controller class listens for events being send from the View(s), updates Model, then notifies View(s) about any event which occurred.
Author:
AndreaAltomare

  • Method Details

    • run

      public void run()
      Run() method for Controller class, to let the game flow be controlled in a separated thread from the one into which run the connection Socket. This method is run when a new game needs to start.
      Specified by:
      run in interface java.lang.Runnable

    • update

      public void update​(java.lang.Object o)
      Computes a generic Event received by View(s). [This method is not actually called anytime because View is not supposed to ever generate it. So Receiving this kind of generic Event means an error occurred in the View.]
      Specified by:
      update in interface VCEventListener
      Parameters:
      o - Event: Generic Object representing an Event

    • postExecutionOperations

      private void postExecutionOperations​(java.lang.String playerNickname, MoveOutcomeType moveOutcome)
      Executes operations after a Movement or a Construction. Checks for a possible Undo requested by the Player who made the last move, then (if necessary) proceeds with eventual Turn state switching and game saving.
      Parameters:
      playerNickname - Player who made the last move
      moveOutcome - Move's outcome

    • moveSucceeded

      private boolean moveSucceeded​(MoveOutcomeType moveOutcome)
      Tells if a move's outcome is positive or negative (i.e. if it succeeded or not).
      Parameters:
      moveOutcome - Move's outcome to check
      Returns:
      (Move succeeded ? true : false)
